text:
Exercise: Team API Project!
1) Make the Rails or React.js app
Choose ONE person from your individual team to make a new Rails or React app
That person pushes that app to GitHub, then adds the other members as collaborators
Every OTHER member clones the app and runs `bundle install` or `npm install`

2) Practice one pull request
Everyone watches one person follow the pull request guide to make a new branch, make some trivial change in the code (add a comment to any file), and make a pull request on GitHub.
Someone else merges the code on GitHub.
Repeat for each member in the group!
BE SURE TO FOLLOW THE PULL REQUEST GUIDE - NO ONE SHOULD BE PUSHING TO THE MAIN BRANCH!

3) Mob program for ~30 minutes
Mob Programming is a software development approach where the whole team works on the same thing, at the same time, in the same space, and at the same computer
This helps ensure everyone in the group understands what needs to get built out!
BE SURE TO FOLLOW THE PULL REQUEST GUIDE - NO ONE SHOULD BE PUSHING TO THE MAIN BRANCH!

4) Divide up the work individually or in pairs
First follow the pull request cheat sheet to make sure everyone has the most up-to-date code
Try to work on small features and make pull requests frequently (as opposed to working for two hours then making a pull request that’s very out of date)
BE SURE TO FOLLOW THE PULL REQUEST GUIDE - NO ONE SHOULD BE PUSHING TO THE MAIN BRANCH!

Choose ONE person from your individual team to make a new Rails or React app
That person pushes that app to GitHub, then adds the other members as collaborators
Every OTHER member clones the app and runs

2) Practice one pull request
Everyone watches one person follow the pull request guide to make a new branch, make some trivial change in the code (add a comment to any file), and make a pull request on GitHub.
Someone else merges the code on GitHub.
Repeat for each member in the group!

Mob Programming is a software development approach where the whole team works on the same thing, at the same time, in the same space, and at the same computer
